48127.「……ふぉっふぉっふぉ。\n わしは かつて オルフェアの町で\n 職人として:
Woo hoo hoo. I used to be a tool maker in the Town of Orphea. But the natural beauty of this forest has captivated me. Now I have retired
and live a quiet life here.

48128.「ピプゼールは わしじゃが……？\n ……なんと 鍛冶屋のレポッチが\n 魔法の:
Am I the Pipzer...? ...Oh, no. Repotchi the blacksmith is asking you to make him a magic tool?
Hmm. I'm sorry to bother you, but I'm
just a retired craftsman. I can't make a magic tool like that. What is it? You perfected Nablette the cake maker by creating The Magic
Oven? Hmmm.... That's right. There may have been magic in that oven, but I don't think it was the magic. But I did not create the magic.
This is a true copy of The Magic Oven. The blacksmith's son will understand if he sees it. Go ahead, take it.

48131.「レポッチ……鍛冶屋のせがれなら 知っておる。\n わしの 職人仲間じゃった男の:
I know Repotchi, the blacksmith's son. He is the son of the man who was my craftsman companion. I met him when he was but a babe.
You must have heard rumors of The Magic Oven somewhere, and if I show you a copy of it, you will understand. I'm sorry, but you'll have to
deliver it to him.

48132.「鍛冶屋のせがれに 写真を届けてくれたか。\n これを機に あやつも 目を覚まし:
Did you deliver the shatrue to the blacksmith's son? I hope this will wake him up. The Magic Oven is just a fictional story
about Nablette, who used to tell her children the secrets of her cake making in a funny way. It's a humorous story about how Nablette,
never one to take advantage of his own skills, built the oven to make my face stand up.
